title: Body armor
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Body_armor/zh-CN "Body armor/zh-CN")

**Body armor**, sometimes referred to as a **suit** of armor, is a type of [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is one of three armor types worn on the torso, along with the [shirt](/wiki/Shirt "Shirt") and [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak") - as a result, body armor may also refer collectively to all three slots, with **torso armor** referring to this slot specifically.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)
- [2 List of body armor](#List_of_body_armor)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 Variants](#Variants)

## Description

Body armor is generally the primary source of [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") for the [player](/wiki/Player "Player") character and [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster") in the dungeon, and the more AC a piece of body armor provides, the more rare or heavy it usually is. Body armor is also one of two armor types to have any form of [magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation"), with the other being cloaks.

## Strategy

While body armor is often heavy, it can provide a significant boost to your AC. The two most valued varieties of body armor are: the [mithril-coats](/wiki/Mithril-coat "Mithril-coat"), which provide stellar AC but interfere with [spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting") and see use up to the mid-game at latest; and [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail"), which all characters eventually seek out as soon as possible and is almost always part of an [ascension kit](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit"). Both of these body armor types are immune to [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion") and provide an excellent AC reduction for their weight.

## History

Body armor is present as an armor slot in [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), as well as Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, and appears in [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").
